meanings.definition: A person who carries a coat of arms.
meanings.sent1: The armigero proudly displayed the family coat of arms at the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The armigero's role was to protect and represent the noble family's emblem.
meanings.sent3: The armigero accidentally tripped over his own coat of arms, causing a moment of laughter.
meanings.sent4: She was the armigero of the family, carrying the history and honor of their lineage.
meanings.sent5: The armigero's presence was like a walking museum of the family's heritage.

meanings.definition: To bear or display a coat of arms.
meanings.sent1: He will armigero the shield during the parade to showcase the family's history.
meanings.sent2: The knight will armigero the emblem on his shield before heading into battle.
meanings.sent3: The artist decided to armigero the coat of arms on a massive canvas for the exhibition.
meanings.sent4: She chose to armigero the symbol proudly on her banner, representing her lineage.
meanings.sent5: The flag bearer will armigero the coat of arms high during the procession, honoring tradition.
